sentence.text: The elder sister came to our attention at 8.4 years of age with short stature: her height was 92 cm (−6 SD) with markedly short upper and lower extremities.
The proband was born after a normal, full-term pregnancy of healthy Vietnamese parents with the length of 50 cm.
She exhibits extremely short and broad fingers and toes, and both great toes were larger than her other toes.
Her facial appearance and cognitive function are normal (Figure 1).
Radiographic results demonstrated short tubular bones of arms and legs without any missing or fused bones.
Arm X-ray revealed bowing pattern of the radius, comparably equal length of the ulna and radius and no dislocation of the radial head.
The metacarpals and phalanges of the hands were short and broad with cone-shaped epiphyses, especially in the proximal phalanges.
Similar patterns were observed in the metatarsals and phalanges of toes, especially in the bones of the great toes which were notably larger than other toes (Figure 2).
